data.title: Upcoming Line Improvements
data.meta_description: Here you will find a complete list of planned engineering works and changes to Iarnród Éireann rail services.
data.text:
Belfast Services

Wednesday 3rd July to Sunday early Autumn

From Wednesday 3rd July to early Autumn the line between Lisburn and Belfast will be closed to facilitate works associated with the construction and opening of the new Belfast Grand Central Station.

Monday – Friday: 21.35 Belfast to Connolly is advanced to 20.05

Saturdays Only: 21.28 Belfast to Connolly is advanced to 20.05

During this period, Enterprise services will operate as normal between Dublin Connolly and Portadown only.

Bus transfers will be in place between Newry and Belfast for customers travelling to/from Belfast.

Customers for Lurgan, Moira & Lisburn can avail of local Translink NI Railways services between Portadown and Lisburn as normal.

The following Saturday services will not operate:

09:36 Belfast to Dublin Connolly

12:21 Dublin Connolly to Belfast

The following Sunday services will not operate:

17:05 Belfast to Dublin Connolly

13:00 Dublin Connolly to Belfast

Saturday, 3rd August - Monday, 5th August

Engineering works will take place between: Malahide/Drogheda and Belfast/Newry on Saturday 3rd, Sunday 4th, and Monday 5th August.

There will be no train service between Malahide and Belfast.

Enterprise services: Bus transfers will operate between Connolly and Belfast, calling at Drogheda/Dundalk and Newry. Passengers travelling to Portadown, please change at Newry.

Please note alterations below:

Mon-Fri 21:35 Belfast to Connolly is advanced to 20:05

Saturday 21:28 Belfast to Connolly is advanced to 20:05

Northern commuter Dundalk/Drogheda services: The following stations are closed for train services: Dundalk, Drogheda, Laytown, Gormonston, Balbriggan, Skerries, Rush & Lusk and Donabate.

A limited bus transfer service will operate between Drogheda and Connolly, calling at Drogheda/Balbriggan/Donabate/Connolly and between Skerries/Rush & Lusk/Connolly.
